comments.body: If the only use case for this class is to produce `ParticipantSessionConfiguration`s, laziness is likely to not be useful.
Removed the laziness. I think it was useful about half-way in, but not any more.

```suggestion
    for ((host, port) <- participantAddresses) yield
      ParticipantSessionConfiguration(host, port, ssl, partyAllocation)
```
A `for`-comprehension probably makes the destructuring a bit more terse.
If you accept this suggestion, you may want to give a second spin at `scalafmt`.
